definition: precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
surname Wei
danger/to endanger/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
as/as if/such as
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
egg/ovum/spawn/(coll.) testicles/(old) penis/(expletive) fucking

sentences.english: But organic food is so popular that its value system is in jeopardy .
sentences.chinese: 可是有机食物很受欢迎，它的代价系统也危如累卵。

sentences.english: More was at stake than just the fate of the two men.
sentences.chinese: 比起这两个人的命运，还有许多事情危如累卵。

sentences.english: There's way too much at stake - a company's success, lots of money, and your own reputation.
sentences.chinese: 那样会让公司的成功，财富和名誉危如累卵。

sentences.english: If you insist on doing like that, you will make the company's reputation and wealth on a razor's edge.
sentences.chinese: 如果你坚持那样做，会让公司的名誉和财富危如累卵。

definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
perilous situation
imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
dangerous situation/venerable old age
great mansion on the verge of collapse (idiom); hopeless situation
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
soldiers at the city walls (idiom); fig. at a critical juncture
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
